Biology is the scientific study of life and living organisms.
Biology means the study of living things and their interactions with the environment.

patterns: What are the branches of biology?
Name the major branches of biology
What are the main divisions of biology?
responses: The major branches of biology are botany, zoology, and microbiology.
Biology has three main branches: botany (study of plants), zoology (study of animals), and microbiology (study of microorganisms).
A cell is the basic structural, functional, and biological unit of all living organisms.
Cells are the smallest units of life that can carry out all life processes.

patterns: What are the types of cells?
responses: There are two main types of cells: prokaryotic and eukaryotic cells.
Cells can be prokaryotic (without a nucleus) or eukaryotic (with a nucleus).
A tissue is a group of similar cells that perform a specific function.
In biology, tissue refers to a collection of similar cells working together to carry out a particular function.
Transport in biology refers to the movement of substances like water, minerals, and food within organisms.
In plants, transport involves xylem and phloem for movement of water and nutrients.
Respiration is the process by which living organisms release energy from food.
It is a biochemical process that converts glucose into energy.
Excretion is the removal of metabolic waste products from the body.
In humans, excretion is carried out mainly by the kidneys.
Growth is an irreversible increase in size and mass of an organism.
It involves cell division, elongation, and differentiation.
Reproduction is the biological process by which organisms produce offspring.
It ensures the continuation of a species.
Nutrition is the process by which living organisms obtain and use food for growth and energy.
It includes autotrophic and heterotrophic modes of nutrition.
Photosynthesis is the process by which green plants make food using sunlight, carbon dioxide, and water.
It takes place in the chloroplasts of plant cells.
